| 1. **Management** | | | | | | | |
| * 1. **Management of Security** | | | | | | | |
| 1. | HACCP Committee   * Established * Appointed * Communicated to all levels * Trained on FS procedures | | | | 4 | Will form part of Quality and Food Safety meeting. All issues pertaining security will be discussed on meeting and actions taken. | |
| 2. | Security awareness   * Communicated * Reporting structure in place | | | | 4 | Form part of Induction program for new personnel. Regular training on security alertness. | |
| 3. | Emergency preparedness and response   * Plan in place * Communicated * Reporting structure in place | | | | 4 | Incident Reporting 3.11.1  Risk management team established and documented | |
| 4. | Recall system   * Recall procedure in place * Communicated * Recall team in place * Relevant info displayed * Routinely verified * Reporting structure in place | | | | 4 | Procedure 3.11  Mock recall tested annually  Reporting structure in place  Annual review of HACCP Committee as part of the Management review meeting | |
| 1. **Site** | | | | | | | |
| 1 | Perimeter protection   * In place * Inspection/monitor frequency * Reporting structure in place in case of risk identified | | | | 4 | Premises fenced.  Controlled access.  Alarm and surveillance cameras  Secured perimeters to restrict access to the facility & related buildings | |
| 2 | Access control   * Restricted access * Minimised entrances | | | | 4 | Keypad  Reporting system in place for visitors – report at reception  Personnel have to report if unauthorised or unidentified personnel are in area | |
| 3 | Adequate lighting  (interior and exterior) | | | | 4 | Adequate exterior lighting provided around grounds | |
|  | | | | | | | |
| 1. | Chemicals   * Controlled access * Adequate storage * Restricted access to storage area * MSDS in place | | | | 4 | Storage areas – chemical store and finished product – locked at all times  Only authorised people allowed in store  MSDS on shared company drive available | |
| 2. | Hazardous chemicals   * Identification / isolation * Controlled access * Method of disposal in place | | | | 4 | None at site | |
| 3. | Pesticides   * Controlled access * Used in accordance to Food regulations | | | | 4 | None stored on site – pest control done by Contractor | |
| 1. **Human Element** | | | | | | | |
| **3.1 Employees** | | | | | | | |
| 1. | System in place for   * Screening * Identification & Location on site * Identification and recognition in plant * Monitoring of unusual health conditions * Monitoring of unusual behaviour (malicious contamination) * Adequate Food Security training * Control microbiological | | | | 4 | Medical pre-employment  Regular Quality and Food safety awareness training  Personnel have to report if unauthorised or unidentified personnel are in area - training.  Signing in of all visitors at reception  Clocking system  Remove protective clothing as per personal hygiene procedure  Code on Electronic Keypad changed on termination/resignation of an employee. | |
| 2. | Personal items   * Restricted in facility * Control and labelling of medication in facility * Regular inspections of personal lockers, bags etc. | | | | 4 | Kept in lockers  No cellphones allowed in production areas  Personal Hygiene procedure | |
| **3.2 Public – Visitors and Contractors** | | | | | | | |
| 1. | * Valid reasons for entry * Restricted access * Verification by Departmental managers for entry by contractors | | | | 4 | Awareness to report unidentified persons and any signs of malicious contamination.  Signing in of all visitors | |
| 1. **Operational** | | | | | | | |
| **4.1 Incoming products (Raw materials and packaging)** | | | | | | | |
| 1. | Suppliers approved  Documentation in place | | | | 4 | Approved Suppliers List  Order no on delivery note | |
| 2. | Raw Material & Packaging   * Identifiable/ labelled * Verified against delivery note * Volumes reconciled to delivery note. * Off-loading activities supervised * Inspection conducted on RM integrity * System in place handling non-conforming RM * COA/COC verification for every batch | | | | 4 | COA/COC with each delivery  Off-loading done by forklift drivers  Delivery checked against Order  Non-conformance product handled as per procedure | |
| 3. | Contamination of raw materials through malicious intervention, i.e. contamination of raw materials prior to the raw materials arriving on site. | | | |  | Supplier BRC/FDA certificated.  Vehicle Inspection taken place at raw material supplier as seen on copy of supplier delivery note.  Inspection later in the process. | |
| **4.2 Storage, Incoming and Outgoing products (Restricted Area)** | | | | | | | |
| 1. | Operations conducted in accordance  with Process Control Procedure | | | | 4 | Visitors, contractors allowed access with supervision. Must report to reception.  Stored in separate storage area.  Raw Material Covered of floor on racking or pallet with slip sheets.  Service level agreement with freight company. | |
| 2. | Finished goods   * Storage areas inspected * Product inspected for integrity * Vehicle inspected and sealed after loading * Contamination of intermediate or finished packaging materials through malicious intervention, i.e. placing of contaminants at the packaging manufacturer | | | | 4 | Regular inspection as part of GMP activity audit  Vehicle inspected  Product is packaged and no direct contact with the product.  Virgin poly liners used.  Traceability procedure in place: Product clearly identified (Labelled)  Transport, storage and distribution procedure in place: Picking slip | |
| **4.3 Workshop** | | | | | | | |
| 1. | Maintenance Procedure in place. Foreign objects are controlled to prevent product contamination. Personal Hygiene Standard in place. | | | | 4 | Separate area with swarf mats.  Door is closed at all times  Food grade lubricants are used.  Trained employees.  Clean as you Go Policy. | |
| **4.4 Security of Water and Utilities** | | | | | | | |
| 1. | Limited access to Air, water, Electricity | | | | 4 | Yes | |
| 2. | Non-municipal water systems secured | | | | 4 | Yes | |
| 3. | Generator | | | | 4 | Yes  Fence Securing generator | |
| **4.5 Computer based Systems** | | | | | | | |
| 1. | Restricted access to critical data systems  Controlled access to sensitive information | | | | 4 | Yes – IT system | |
| 2. | Deactivated access upon employee exit | | | | 4 | Yes | |
| 3. | Virus Protection and Back-up systems in place | | | | 4 | Yes  Antivirus program on all computers | |
| 4. | Validation methods for computer security | | | | 4 | Yes | |
| **4.6 Security Strategies** | | | | | | | |
| 1. | | Strategy in place for the identification, segregation and securing of affected product | | | 4 | Quarantine product procedure  Control of non-conforming product procedure | |
| 2. | | Emergency response system including 24hr contact list in place | | | 4 | Emergency numbers | |
| **4.7 Novray, The Royal Portfolio and Pharma Connect (Neighbours with potential access via doors and windows.)** | | | | | | | |
| 1. | | Foreign Objects: Glass Breakage from Novray  Security: Malicious Intervention from Pharma and Novray  Pest Sightings/ Control with atrium. | | | 4 | Shatter-proofed windows.  Glass and Brittle Plastic Register.  Glass Breakage Report Procedure.  Covered Product.  Locked doors/Alarm System in place.  Covered Drains.  Documented Pest Control Procedure in place.  Surveillance Cameras | |

###### Defining Evaluation Score

######

|  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Score | Documentation | | | | | |
| **4** | Written policies and procedures exist and records are used to adequately support the program. | | | | | |
| 3 | Policies and procedures are considered inadequate to properly meet the requirements of this item. Records may be incomplete, inaccurate, or used inconsistently. | | | | | |
| 2 | Procedures and / or records are missing or insufficient for effective implementation. | | | | | |
| **1** | Procedures and records have not been developed. No recording is performed. | | | | | |
| **0** | Complete program has not been developed. No records exist. | | | | | |
| Rating | | Score | | Conclusion | | |
| Excellent | | 90% or higher | | Acceptable | | |
| Good | | 85 – 89.99% | | Acceptable | | |
| Fair | | 80 - 84.99% | | Acceptable | | |
| Conditional | | 75.01 – 79.99 % | | Minor deficiencies can be quickly resolved to achieve acceptable levels. Corrective Actions are documented and achievable.  Re-audit not necessary. | | |
| Automatic Fail | | 75% or less | | Needs Improvement – does not meet security requirements. Re-evaluation is necessary. | | |
